metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8964 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in PCRE 8.36 and earlier allows remote attackersto cause a denial of service (crash) or have other unspecified impact via acrafted regular expression, related to an assertion that allows zerorepeats.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8964` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.1').
